trans-unit.source: This article describes how to add playback of adaptive streaming multimedia content to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to add playback of adaptive streaming multimedia content to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: This feature currently supports playback of Http Live Streaming (HLS) and Dynamic Streaming over HTTP (DASH) content.
trans-unit.target: This feature currently supports playback of Http Live Streaming (HLS) and Dynamic Streaming over HTTP (DASH) content.

trans-unit.source: Adaptive Streaming
trans-unit.target: Adaptive Streaming

trans-unit.source: Adaptive Streaming
trans-unit.target: Adaptive Streaming

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: This article describes how to add playback of adaptive streaming multimedia content to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to add playback of adaptive streaming multimedia content to a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: This feature currently supports playback of Http Live Streaming (HLS) and Dynamic Streaming over HTTP (DASH) content.
trans-unit.target: This feature currently supports playback of Http Live Streaming (HLS) and Dynamic Streaming over HTTP (DASH) content.

trans-unit.source: Simple adaptive streaming with MediaElement
trans-unit.target: Simple adaptive streaming with MediaElement

trans-unit.source: To display adaptive streaming multimedia in a XAML-based app, add a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) control to your page.
trans-unit.target: To display adaptive streaming multimedia in a XAML-based app, add a [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) control to your page.

trans-unit.source: MediaElementXAML
trans-unit.target: MediaElementXAML

trans-unit.source: Set the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227420) property of the **MediaElement** to the URI of a DASH or HLS manifest file.
trans-unit.target: Set the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227420) property of the **MediaElement** to the URI of a DASH or HLS manifest file.

trans-unit.source: ManifestSource
trans-unit.target: ManifestSource

trans-unit.source: Adaptive streaming with AdaptiveMediaSource
trans-unit.target: Adaptive streaming with AdaptiveMediaSource

trans-unit.source: If your app requires more advanced adaptive streaming features, such as providing custom HTTP headers, monitoring the current download and playback bitrates, or adjusting the ratios that determine when the system switches bitrates of the adaptive stream, use the [**AdaptiveMediaSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn946912) object.
trans-unit.target: If your app requires more advanced adaptive streaming features, such as providing custom HTTP headers, monitoring the current download and playback bitrates, or adjusting the ratios that determine when the system switches bitrates of the adaptive stream, use the [**AdaptiveMediaSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn946912) object.

trans-unit.source: The adaptive streaming APIs are found in the [**Windows.Media.Streaming.Adaptive**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn931279) namespace.
trans-unit.target: The adaptive streaming APIs are found in the [**Windows.Media.Streaming.Adaptive**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn931279) namespace.

trans-unit.source: AdaptiveStreamingUsing
trans-unit.target: AdaptiveStreamingUsing

trans-unit.source: Initialize the **AdaptiveMediaSource** with the URI of an adaptive streaming manifest file by calling [**CreateFromUriAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn931261).
trans-unit.target: Initialize the **AdaptiveMediaSource** with the URI of an adaptive streaming manifest file by calling [**CreateFromUriAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn931261).

trans-unit.source: The [**AdaptiveMediaSourceCreationStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn946917) value returned from this method lets you know if the media source was created successfully.
trans-unit.target: The [**AdaptiveMediaSourceCreationStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn946917) value returned from this method lets you know if the media source was created successfully.

trans-unit.source: If so, you can set the object as the stream source for your **MediaElement** by calling [**SetMediaStreamSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn299029).
trans-unit.target: If so, you can set the object as the stream source for your **MediaElement** by calling [**SetMediaStreamSource**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn299029).

trans-unit.source: In this example, the [**AvailableBitrates**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn931257) property is queried to determine the maximum supported bitrate for this stream, and then that value is set as the inital bitrate.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the [**AvailableBitrates**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn931257) property is queried to determine the maximum supported bitrate for this stream, and then that value is set as the inital bitrate.

trans-unit.source: This example also registers handlers for the [**DownloadRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn931272), [**DownloadBitrateChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn931269), and [**PlaybackBitrateChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn931278) events which are discussed later in this article.
trans-unit.target: This example also registers handlers for the [**DownloadRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn931272), [**DownloadBitrateChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn931269), and [**PlaybackBitrateChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn931278) events which are discussed later in this article.

trans-unit.source: InitializeAMS
trans-unit.target: InitializeAMS

trans-unit.source: If you need to set custom HTTP headers for getting the manifest file, you can create an [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) object, set the desired headers, and then pass the object into the overload of **CreateFromUriAsync**.
trans-unit.target: If you need to set custom HTTP headers for getting the manifest file, you can create an [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) object, set the desired headers, and then pass the object into the overload of **CreateFromUriAsync**.

trans-unit.source: InitializeAMSWithHttpClient
trans-unit.target: InitializeAMSWithHttpClient

trans-unit.source: The [**DownloadRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn931272) event is raised when the system is about to retrieve a resource from the server.
trans-unit.target: The [**DownloadRequested**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn931272) event is raised when the system is about to retrieve a resource from the server.

trans-unit.source: The [**AdaptiveMediaSourceDownloadRequestedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn946935) passed into the event handler exposes properties that provide information about the resource being requested such as the type and URI of the resource.
trans-unit.target: The [**AdaptiveMediaSourceDownloadRequestedEventArgs**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn946935) passed into the event handler exposes properties that provide information about the resource being requested such as the type and URI of the resource.

trans-unit.source: You can use the **DownloadRequested** event handler to modify the resource request by updating the properties of the [**AdaptiveMediaSourceDownloadResult**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn946942) object provided by the event args.
trans-unit.target: You can use the **DownloadRequested** event handler to modify the resource request by updating the properties of the [**AdaptiveMediaSourceDownloadResult**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn946942) object provided by the event args.

trans-unit.source: In the example below, the URI from which the resource will be retrieved is modified by updating the [**ResourceUri**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn931250) properties of the result object.
trans-unit.target: In the example below, the URI from which the resource will be retrieved is modified by updating the [**ResourceUri**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn931250) properties of the result object.

trans-unit.source: You can override the content of the requested resource by setting the [**Buffer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn946943) or [**InputStream**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn931249) properties of the result object.
trans-unit.target: You can override the content of the requested resource by setting the [**Buffer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn946943) or [**InputStream**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn931249) properties of the result object.

trans-unit.source: In the example below, the contents of the manifest resource are replaced by setting the **Buffer** property.
trans-unit.target: In the example below, the contents of the manifest resource are replaced by setting the **Buffer** property.

trans-unit.source: Note that if you are updating the resource request with data that is obtained asynchronously, such as retrieving data from a remote server or asynchronous user authentication, you must call [**AdaptiveMediaSourceDownloadRequestedEventArgs.GetDeferral**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn946936) to get a deferral and then call [**Complete**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn946934) when the operation is complete to signal the system that the download request operation can continue.
trans-unit.target: Note that if you are updating the resource request with data that is obtained asynchronously, such as retrieving data from a remote server or asynchronous user authentication, you must call [**AdaptiveMediaSourceDownloadRequestedEventArgs.GetDeferral**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn946936) to get a deferral and then call [**Complete**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn946934) when the operation is complete to signal the system that the download request operation can continue.

trans-unit.source: AMSDownloadRequested
trans-unit.target: AMSDownloadRequested

trans-unit.source: The **AdaptiveMediaSource** object provides events that allow you to react when the download or playback bitrates change.
trans-unit.target: The **AdaptiveMediaSource** object provides events that allow you to react when the download or playback bitrates change.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the current bitrates are simply updated in the UI.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the current bitrates are simply updated in the UI.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can modify the ratios that determine when the system switches bitrates of the adaptive stream.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can modify the ratios that determine when the system switches bitrates of the adaptive stream.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [**AdvancedSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt628697) property.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [**AdvancedSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt628697) property.

trans-unit.source: AMSBitrateEvents
trans-unit.target: AMSBitrateEvents
